definition: letter/mail/CL:封[feng1]/to trust/to believe/to profess faith in/truthful/confidence/trust/at will/at random
to offer (tribute)/to present respectfully (to superior, ancestor, deity etc)/to esteem/to revere/to believe in (a religion)/to wait upon/to accept orders (from superior)

sentences.english: In the beginning, they believed in Tengri Shamanism and were nomadic.
sentences.chinese: 他们最初信奉萨满教，过着游牧生活。

sentences.english: The fragmentations of teacher beliefs were eventually damage education hope.
sentences.chinese: 教师信奉的支离破碎最终则损毁了教育的希望。

sentences.english: As can be seen from the cartoon, nowadays many people follow the hen and swarm into the tide of promise-making.
sentences.chinese: 从图中看出，现如今很多人跟随潮流，信奉承诺制。

sentences.english: Ancient Chinese philosophers were born out of sorcery.
sentences.chinese: 中国古代哲学家们起初多信奉巫术。

sentences.english: So I believe in a very progressive tax on income.
sentences.chinese: 所以我更信奉一个非常“激进”的所得税体系。

sentences.english: Rhodium-plated pierced earrings with Jonquil crystal lemon and leaf in Peridot crystal.
sentences.chinese: 铑镀穿耳环与信奉水晶柠檬叶在橄榄石晶体。

sentences.english: People believe in all sorts of things.
sentences.chinese: 人们信奉各种各样的事物。

sentences.english: Some of the most energetic people in the life-extension movement are intensely religious .
sentences.chinese: 在生命扩展运动中最积极的人们是热忱信奉宗教的人。

sentences.english: Only methodologies that encourage and embrace such change will be effective.
sentences.chinese: 只有鼓励和信奉这种更改的方法才是有效方法。

sentences.english: Generally speaking, eunuchs in the Ming dynasty believed in Buddhism and had countless contacts with Buddhist monks.
sentences.chinese: 明代宦官普遍信奉，与佛教僧团也有广泛的交往结纳。

sentences.english: The French culture also espouses a low-stress lifestyle.
sentences.chinese: 法国文化信奉一种低压力的生活方式。

sentences.english: He was charged with heresy and arrested by the lnquisition.
sentences.chinese: 他被控告信奉邪说，后被宗教法庭逮捕。

sentences.english: Believes in the human not to have the foresight to have the sorrow near at hand, guarantees enterprise's vitality.
sentences.chinese: 信奉人无远虑必有近忧，来保证事业的生命力。

sentences.english: He was from the Netherlands, the son of a Mennonite minister, and was drawn to Judaism.
sentences.chinese: 他来自荷兰，父亲是门诺派牧师，本人却信奉犹太教。

sentences.english: Or have we, like Paul, embraced the self-sacrificing grace of Jesus Christ?
sentences.chinese: 我们是要信奉这样的观念呢？

sentences.english: It's only holy to people who take it as holy.
sentences.chinese: 只有信奉的人来说，才神圣。

definition: to believe firmly/devout in one's faith
to hold up (as an model)/to hold in esteem/to revere/to advocate
religious belief/to practice a faith/to be religious
